"... But let's say you're young and you're just coming out of college, what are your risks? You're not going to starve, certainly not in any kind of modern economy. It's so easy to earn enough money just to live somewhere and eat food. Mostly people are afraid of failure. But people should be less risk averse, when there's not much at risk at all."
"Take significant risks to build what you wan to see in the world."
"What we fight with is so small, and when we win it makes us small. What we want is to be defeated, decisively, by successively greater and greater things."

"Failure meant a stripping away of the inessential. I stopped pretending to myself that I was anything other than what I was, and began to direct all my energy to finishing the only work that mattered to me. I was set free, because my greatest fear had been realized, and I was still alive, and I still had a daughter whom I adored, and I had an old typewriter, and a big idea. And so rock bottom became a solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life."

If you're not pushing yourself beyond the comfort zone, if you're not demanding more from yourself - expanding and learning as you go - you're choosing a numb existence. â€œFor what itâ€™s worth: itâ€™s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. Thereâ€™s no time limit, stop whenever you want. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life youâ€™re proud of. "Do I have an original thought in my head? My bald head. Maybe if I were happier, my hair wouldn't be falling out. Life is short. I need to make the most of it. Today is the first day of the rest of my life. I'm a walking clichÃ©. I really need to go to the doctor and have my leg checked. There's something wrong. A bump. The dentist called again. I'm way overdue. If I stop putting things off, I would be happier. All I do is sit on my fat ass. If my ass wasn't fat I would be happier. I wouldn't have to wear these shirts with the tails out all the time. Like that's fooling anyone. Fat ass. I should start jogging again. Five miles a day. Really do it this time. Maybe rock climbing. I need to turn my life around. What do I need to do? I need to fall in love. I need to have a girlfriend. I need to read more, improve myself. What if I learned Russian or something? Or took up an instrument? I could speak Chinese. I'd be the screenwriter who speaks Chinese and plays the oboe. That would be cool. I should get my hair cut short. Stop trying to fool myself and everyone else into thinking I have a full head of hair. How pathetic is that? Just be real. Confident. Isn't that what women are attracted to? Men don't have to be attractive. But that's not true. Especially these days. Almost as much pressure on men as there is on women these days. Why should I be made to feel I have to apologize for my existence? Maybe it's my brain chemistry. Maybe that's what's wrong with me. Bad chemistry. All my problems and anxiety can be reduced to a chemical imbalance or some kind of misfiring synapses. I need to get help for that. But I'll still be ugly though. Nothing's gonna change that."
To look life in the face
always to look life in the face
and to know it for what it is
to love it for what it is
and then to put it away

I would still go mad with tenderness...
at the mere sight of her face.

The faintest sound finally accumulated the strength to awake his heart from the eternal numbness. Crawled from the bed and wondered to the window, he looked so deeply into the night, like a beam of laser shooting into the heavenâ€™s hollowness. What a snow night, the snowflakes were shredded through an invisible griddle loosely onto the earth. The wind was chilly, even the slightest breeze can cut your skin in its subtle bloody form. However, the snowflakes reflected deceptive binge lightness, fabricating a realm of warmness. His sight moved slowly while firmly onto the ground, as if he was about to rip the blackness into half. The covered snow was like the vomit, so repulsive to him, in the manifestation of all the goodness that is tramped by the vulgarity and conformation. That was the moment; a world that is so unfamiliar and corrupted was exposed in front of him, in its most intense form. The way he fell looked so natural, like the leaf detaches from the branch or the snow slides from the roof. To him, the only regret was, the way he fell looked like a dumpling, which his late mother used to make for him.- Asiriel
